scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: My lord, I'll tell you; that self bill is urged,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Which in the eleventh year of the last king's reign

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Was like, and had indeed against us pass'd,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: But that the scambling and unquiet time

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Did push it out of farther question.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: But how, my lord, shall we resist it now?

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: It must be thought on. If it pass against us,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: We lose the better half of our possession:

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: For all the temporal lands which men devout

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: By testament have given to the church

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Would they strip from us; being valued thus:

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: As much as would maintain, to the king's honour,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Full fifteen earls and fifteen hundred knights,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Six thousand and two hundred good esquires;

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: And, to relief of lazars and weak age,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Of indigent faint souls past corporal toil.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: A hundred almshouses right well supplied;

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: And to the coffers of the king beside,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: A thousand pounds by the year: thus runs the bill.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: This would drink deep.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: 'Twould drink the cup and all.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: But what prevention?

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: The king is full of grace and fair regard.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: And a true lover of the holy church.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: The courses of his youth promised it not.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: The breath no sooner left his father's body,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: But that his wildness, mortified in him,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Seem'd to die too; yea, at that very moment

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Consideration, like an angel, came

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: And whipp'd the offending Adam out of him,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Leaving his body as a paradise,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: To envelop and contain celestial spirits.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Never was such a sudden scholar made;

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Never came reformation in a flood,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: With such a heady currance, scouring faults

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Nor never Hydra-headed wilfulness

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: So soon did lose his seat and all at once

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: As in this king.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: We are blessed in the change.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Hear him but reason in divinity,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: And all-admiring with an inward wish

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: You would desire the king were made a prelate:

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Hear him debate of commonwealth affairs,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: You would say it hath been all in all his study:

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: List his discourse of war, and you shall hear

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: A fearful battle render'd you in music:

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Turn him to any cause of policy,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: The Gordian knot of it he will unloose,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Familiar as his garter: that, when he speaks,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: The air, a charter'd libertine, is still,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: And the mute wonder lurketh in men's ears,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: To steal his sweet and honey'd sentences;

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: So that the art and practic part of life

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Must be the mistress to this theoric:

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Which is a wonder how his grace should glean it,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Since his addiction was to courses vain,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: His companies unletter'd, rude and shallow,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: His hours fill'd up with riots, banquets, sports,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: And never noted in him any study,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Any retirement, any sequestration

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: From open haunts and popularity.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: The strawberry grows underneath the nettle

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: And wholesome berries thrive and ripen best

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: Neighbour'd by fruit of baser quality:

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: And so the prince obscured his contemplation

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: Under the veil of wildness; which, no doubt,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: Grew like the summer grass, fastest by night,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: Unseen, yet crescive in his faculty.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: It must be so; for miracles are ceased;

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: And therefore we must needs admit the means

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: How things are perfected.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: But, my good lord,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: How now for mitigation of this bill

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: Urged by the commons? Doth his majesty

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: Incline to it, or no?

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: He seems indifferent,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Or rather swaying more upon our part

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Than cherishing the exhibiters against us;

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: For I have made an offer to his majesty,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Upon our spiritual convocation

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: And in regard of causes now in hand,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Which I have open'd to his grace at large,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: As touching France, to give a greater sum

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Than ever at one time the clergy yet

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Did to his predecessors part withal.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: How did this offer seem received, my lord?

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: With good acceptance of his majesty;

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Save that there was not time enough to hear,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: As I perceived his grace would fain have done,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: The severals and unhidden passages

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Of his true titles to some certain dukedoms

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: And generally to the crown and seat of France

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Derived from Edward, his great-grandfather.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: What was the impediment that broke this off?

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: The French ambassador upon that instant

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Craved audience; and the hour, I think, is come

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: To give him hearing: is it four o'clock?

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: It is.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Then go we in, to know his embassy;

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Which I could with a ready guess declare,

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Before the Frenchman speak a word of it.

scene: SCENE I.  London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.
speaker: ELY
line: I'll wait upon you, and I long to hear it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Where is my gracious Lord of Canterbury?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: Not here in presence.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Send for him, good uncle.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: WESTMORELAND
line: Shall we call in the ambassador, my liege?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Not yet, my cousin: we would be resolved,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Before we hear him, of some things of weight

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That task our thoughts, concerning us and France.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: God and his angels guard your sacred throne

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: And make you long become it!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Sure, we thank you.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: My learned lord, we pray you to proceed

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And justly and religiously unfold

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Why the law Salique that they have in France

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Or should, or should not, bar us in our claim:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And God forbid, my dear and faithful lord,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That you should fashion, wrest, or bow your reading,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Or nicely charge your understanding soul

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: With opening titles miscreate, whose right

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Suits not in native colours with the truth;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: For God doth know how many now in health

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Shall drop their blood in approbation

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Of what your reverence shall incite us to.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Therefore take heed how you impawn our person,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: How you awake our sleeping sword of war:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: We charge you, in the name of God, take heed;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: For never two such kingdoms did contend

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Without much fall of blood; whose guiltless drops

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Are every one a woe, a sore complaint

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: 'Gainst him whose wrong gives edge unto the swords

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That make such waste in brief mortality.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Under this conjuration, speak, my lord;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: For we will hear, note and believe in heart

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That what you speak is in your conscience wash'd

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: As pure as sin with baptism.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Then hear me, gracious sovereign, and you peers,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: That owe yourselves, your lives and services

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: To this imperial throne. There is no bar

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: To make against your highness' claim to France

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: But this, which they produce from Pharamond,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: 'In terram Salicam mulieres ne succedant:'

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: 'No woman shall succeed in Salique land:'

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Which Salique land the French unjustly gloze

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: To be the realm of France, and Pharamond

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: The founder of this law and female bar.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Yet their own authors faithfully affirm

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: That the land Salique is in Germany,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Between the floods of Sala and of Elbe;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Where Charles the Great, having subdued the Saxons,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: There left behind and settled certain French;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Who, holding in disdain the German women

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: For some dishonest manners of their life,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Establish'd then this law; to wit, no female

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Should be inheritrix in Salique land:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Which Salique, as I said, 'twixt Elbe and Sala,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Is at this day in Germany call'd Meisen.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Then doth it well appear that Salique law

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Was not devised for the realm of France:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Nor did the French possess the Salique land

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Until four hundred one and twenty years

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: After defunction of King Pharamond,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Idly supposed the founder of this law;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Who died within the year of our redemption

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Four hundred twenty-six; and Charles the Great

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Subdued the Saxons, and did seat the French

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Beyond the river Sala, in the year

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Eight hundred five. Besides, their writers say,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: King Pepin, which deposed Childeric,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Did, as heir general, being descended

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Of Blithild, which was daughter to King Clothair,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Make claim and title to the crown of France.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Hugh Capet also, who usurped the crown

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Of Charles the duke of Lorraine, sole heir male

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Of the true line and stock of Charles the Great,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: To find his title with some shows of truth,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: 'Through, in pure truth, it was corrupt and naught,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Convey'd himself as heir to the Lady Lingare,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Daughter to Charlemain, who was the son

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: To Lewis the emperor, and Lewis the son

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Of Charles the Great. Also King Lewis the Tenth,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Who was sole heir to the usurper Capet,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Could not keep quiet in his conscience,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Wearing the crown of France, till satisfied

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: That fair Queen Isabel, his grandmother,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Was lineal of the Lady Ermengare,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: CANTERBURY
line: Daughter to Charles the foresaid duke of Lorraine:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.

line: Shall stand sore charged for the wasteful vengeance

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That shall fly with them: for many a thousand widows

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Shall this his mock mock out of their dear husbands;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Mock mothers from their sons, mock castles down;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And some are yet ungotten and unborn

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That shall have cause to curse the Dauphin's scorn.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: But this lies all within the will of God,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: To whom I do appeal; and in whose name

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Tell you the Dauphin I am coming on,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: To venge me as I may and to put forth

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: My rightful hand in a well-hallow'd cause.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: So get you hence in peace; and tell the Dauphin

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: His jest will savour but of shallow wit,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: When thousands weep more than did laugh at it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Convey them with safe conduct. Fare you well.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: This was a merry message.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: We hope to make the sender blush at it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Therefore, my lords, omit no happy hour

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That may give furtherance to our expedition;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: For we have now no thought in us but France,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Save those to God, that run before our business.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Therefore let our proportions for these wars

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Be soon collected and all things thought upon

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That may with reasonable swiftness add

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: More feathers to our wings; for, God before,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: We'll chide this Dauphin at his father's door.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Therefore let every man now task his thought,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. The Presence chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That this fair action may on foot be brought.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Well met, Corporal Nym.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: Good morrow, Lieutenant Bardolph.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: What, are Ancient Pistol and you friends yet?

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: For my part, I care not: I say little; but when

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: time shall serve, there shall be smiles; but that

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: shall be as it may. I dare not fight; but I will

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: wink and hold out mine iron: it is a simple one; but

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: what though? it will toast cheese, and it will

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: endure cold as another man's sword will: and

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: there's an end.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: I will bestow a breakfast to make you friends; and

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: we'll be all three sworn brothers to France: let it

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: be so, good Corporal Nym.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: Faith, I will live so long as I may, that's the

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: certain of it; and when I cannot live any longer, I

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: will do as I may: that is my rest, that is the

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: rendezvous of it.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: It is certain, corporal, that he is married to Nell

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Quickly: and certainly she did you wrong; for you

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: were troth-plight to her.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: I cannot tell: things must be as they may: men may

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: sleep, and they may have their throats about them at

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: that time; and some say knives have edges. It must

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: be as it may: though patience be a tired mare, yet

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: she will plod. There must be conclusions. Well, I

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: cannot tell.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Here comes Ancient Pistol and his wife: good

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: corporal, be patient here. How now, mine host Pistol!

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Base tike, call'st thou me host? Now, by this hand,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: I swear, I scorn the term; Nor shall my Nell keep lodgers.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: No, by my troth, not long; for we cannot lodge and

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: board a dozen or fourteen gentlewomen that live

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: honestly by the prick of their needles, but it will

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: be thought we keep a bawdy house straight.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: O well a day, Lady, if he be not drawn now! we

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: shall see wilful adultery and murder committed.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Good lieutenant! good corporal! offer nothing here.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: Pish!

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Pish for thee, Iceland dog! thou prick-ear'd cur of Iceland!

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: Good Corporal Nym, show thy valour, and put up your sword.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: Will you shog off? I would have you solus.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: 'Solus,' egregious dog? O viper vile!

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: The 'solus' in thy most mervailous face;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: The 'solus' in thy teeth, and in thy throat,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: And in thy hateful lungs, yea, in thy maw, perdy,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: And, which is worse, within thy nasty mouth!

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: I do retort the 'solus' in thy bowels;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: For I can take, and Pistol's cock is up,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: And flashing fire will follow.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: I am not Barbason; you cannot conjure me. I have an

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: humour to knock you indifferently well. If you grow

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: foul with me, Pistol, I will scour you with my

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: rapier, as I may, in fair terms: if you would walk

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: off, I would prick your guts a little, in good

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: terms, as I may: and that's the humour of it.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: O braggart vile and damned furious wight!

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: The grave doth gape, and doting death is near;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Therefore exhale.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Hear me, hear me what I say: he that strikes the

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: first stroke, I'll run him up to the hilts, as I am a soldier.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: An oath of mickle might; and fury shall abate.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Give me thy fist, thy fore-foot to me give:

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Thy spirits are most tall.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: I will cut thy throat, one time or other, in fair

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: terms: that is the humour of it.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: 'Couple a gorge!'

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: That is the word. I thee defy again.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: O hound of Crete, think'st thou my spouse to get?

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: No; to the spital go,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: And from the powdering tub of infamy

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Fetch forth the lazar kite of Cressid's kind,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Doll Tearsheet she by name, and her espouse:

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: I have, and I will hold, the quondam Quickly

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: For the only she; and--pauca, there's enough. Go to.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Boy
line: Mine host Pistol, you must come to my master, and

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Boy
line: you, hostess: he is very sick, and would to bed.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Boy
line: Good Bardolph, put thy face between his sheets, and

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Boy
line: do the office of a warming-pan. Faith, he's very ill.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Away, you rogue!

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: By my troth, he'll yield the crow a pudding one of

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: these days. The king has killed his heart. Good

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: husband, come home presently.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Come, shall I make you two friends? We must to

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: France together: why the devil should we keep

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: knives to cut one another's throats?

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Let floods o'erswell, and fiends for food howl on!

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: You'll pay me the eight shillings I won of you at betting?

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Base is the slave that pays.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: That now I will have: that's the humour of it.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: As manhood shall compound: push home.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: By this sword, he that makes the first thrust, I'll

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: kill him; by this sword, I will.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Sword is an oath, and oaths must have their course.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Corporal Nym, an thou wilt be friends, be friends:

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: an thou wilt not, why, then, be enemies with me too.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Prithee, put up.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: I shall have my eight shillings I won of you at betting?

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: A noble shalt thou have, and present pay;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: And liquor likewise will I give to thee,

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: And friendship shall combine, and brotherhood:

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: I'll live by Nym, and Nym shall live by me;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Is not this just? for I shall sutler be

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Unto the camp, and profits will accrue.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Give me thy hand.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: I shall have my noble?

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: In cash most justly paid.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: Well, then, that's the humour of't.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: As ever you came of women, come in quickly to Sir

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: John. Ah, poor heart! he is so shaked of a burning

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: quotidian tertian, that it is most lamentable to

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: Hostess
line: behold. Sweet men, come to him.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: The king hath run bad humours on the knight; that's

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: the even of it.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Nym, thou hast spoke the right;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: His heart is fracted and corroborate.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: The king is a good king: but it must be as it may;

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: NYM
line: he passes some humours and careers.

scene: SCENE I.  London. A street.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Let us condole the knight; for, lambkins we will live.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: BEDFORD
line: 'Fore God, his grace is bold, to trust these traitors.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: They shall be apprehended by and by.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: WESTMORELAND
line: How smooth and even they do bear themselves!

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: WESTMORELAND
line: As if allegiance in their bosoms sat,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: WESTMORELAND
line: Crowned with faith and constant loyalty.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: BEDFORD
line: The king hath note of all that they intend,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: BEDFORD
line: By interception which they dream not of.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: Nay, but the man that was his bedfellow,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: Whom he hath dull'd and cloy'd with gracious favours,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: That he should, for a foreign purse, so sell

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: His sovereign's life to death and treachery.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Now sits the wind fair, and we will aboard.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: My Lord of Cambridge, and my kind Lord of Masham,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And you, my gentle knight, give me your thoughts:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Think you not that the powers we bear with us

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Will cut their passage through the force of France,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Doing the execution and the act

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: For which we have in head assembled them?

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: No doubt, my liege, if each man do his best.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: I doubt not that; since we are well persuaded

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: We carry not a heart with us from hence

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That grows not in a fair consent with ours,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Nor leave not one behind that doth not wish

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Success and conquest to attend on us.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: Never was monarch better fear'd and loved

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: Than is your majesty: there's not, I think, a subject

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: That sits in heart-grief and uneasiness

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: Under the sweet shade of your government.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: True: those that were your father's enemies

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: Have steep'd their galls in honey and do serve you

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: With hearts create of duty and of zeal.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: We therefore have great cause of thankfulness;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And shall forget the office of our hand,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Sooner than quittance of desert and merit

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: According to the weight and worthiness.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: So service shall with steeled sinews toil,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: And labour shall refresh itself with hope,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: To do your grace incessant services.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: We judge no less. Uncle of Exeter,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Enlarge the man committed yesterday,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That rail'd against our person: we consider

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: it was excess of wine that set him on;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And on his more advice we pardon him.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: That's mercy, but too much security:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: Let him be punish'd, sovereign, lest example

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: Breed, by his sufferance, more of such a kind.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: O, let us yet be merciful.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: So may your highness, and yet punish too.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: Sir,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: You show great mercy, if you give him life,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: After the taste of much correction.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Alas, your too much love and care of me

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Are heavy orisons 'gainst this poor wretch!

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: If little faults, proceeding on distemper,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Shall not be wink'd at, how shall we stretch our eye

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: When capital crimes, chew'd, swallow'd and digested,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Appear before us? We'll yet enlarge that man,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Though Cambridge, Scroop and Grey, in their dear care

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And tender preservation of our person,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Would have him punished. And now to our French causes:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Who are the late commissioners?

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: I one, my lord:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: Your highness bade me ask for it to-day.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: So did you me, my liege.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: And I, my royal sovereign.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Then, Richard Earl of Cambridge, there is yours;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: There yours, Lord Scroop of Masham; and, sir knight,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Grey of Northumberland, this same is yours:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Read them; and know, I know your worthiness.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: My Lord of Westmoreland, and uncle Exeter,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: We will aboard to night. Why, how now, gentlemen!

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: What see you in those papers that you lose

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: So much complexion? Look ye, how they change!

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Their cheeks are paper. Why, what read you there

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That hath so cowarded and chased your blood

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Out of appearance?

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: I do confess my fault;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: And do submit me to your highness' mercy.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: To which we all appeal.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: The mercy that was quick in us but late,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: By your own counsel is suppress'd and kill'd:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: You must not dare, for shame, to talk of mercy;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: For your own reasons turn into your bosoms,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: As dogs upon their masters, worrying you.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: See you, my princes, and my noble peers,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: These English monsters! My Lord of Cambridge here,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: You know how apt our love was to accord

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: To furnish him with all appertinents

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Belonging to his honour; and this man

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Hath, for a few light crowns, lightly conspired,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And sworn unto the practises of France,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: To kill us here in Hampton: to the which

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: This knight, no less for bounty bound to us

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Than Cambridge is, hath likewise sworn. But, O,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: What shall I say to thee, Lord Scroop? thou cruel,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Ingrateful, savage and inhuman creature!

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Thou that didst bear the key of all my counsels,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That knew'st the very bottom of my soul,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That almost mightst have coin'd me into gold,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Wouldst thou have practised on me for thy use,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: May it be possible, that foreign hire

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Could out of thee extract one spark of evil

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That might annoy my finger? 'tis so strange,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That, though the truth of it stands off as gross

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: As black and white, my eye will scarcely see it.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Treason and murder ever kept together,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: As two yoke-devils sworn to either's purpose,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Working so grossly in a natural cause,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That admiration did not whoop at them:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: But thou, 'gainst all proportion, didst bring in

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Wonder to wait on treason and on murder:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And whatsoever cunning fiend it was

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That wrought upon thee so preposterously

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Hath got the voice in hell for excellence:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: All other devils that suggest by treasons

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Do botch and bungle up damnation

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: With patches, colours, and with forms being fetch'd

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: From glistering semblances of piety;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: But he that temper'd thee bade thee stand up,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Gave thee no instance why thou shouldst do treason,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Unless to dub thee with the name of traitor.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: If that same demon that hath gull'd thee thus

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Should with his lion gait walk the whole world,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: He might return to vasty Tartar back,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And tell the legions 'I can never win

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: A soul so easy as that Englishman's.'

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: O, how hast thou with 'jealousy infected

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: The sweetness of affiance! Show men dutiful?

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Why, so didst thou: seem they grave and learned?

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Why, so didst thou: come they of noble family?

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Why, so didst thou: seem they religious?

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Why, so didst thou: or are they spare in diet,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Free from gross passion or of mirth or anger,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Constant in spirit, not swerving with the blood,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Garnish'd and deck'd in modest complement,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Not working with the eye without the ear,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And but in purged judgment trusting neither?

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Such and so finely bolted didst thou seem:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And thus thy fall hath left a kind of blot,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: To mark the full-fraught man and best indued

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: With some suspicion. I will weep for thee;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: For this revolt of thine, methinks, is like

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Another fall of man. Their faults are open:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Arrest them to the answer of the law;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And God acquit them of their practises!

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: I arrest thee of high treason, by the name of

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: Richard Earl of Cambridge.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: I arrest thee of high treason, by the name of

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: Henry Lord Scroop of Masham.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: I arrest thee of high treason, by the name of

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: EXETER
line: Thomas Grey, knight, of Northumberland.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: Our purposes God justly hath discover'd;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: And I repent my fault more than my death;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: Which I beseech your highness to forgive,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: SCROOP
line: Although my body pay the price of it.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: For me, the gold of France did not seduce;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: Although I did admit it as a motive

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: The sooner to effect what I intended:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: But God be thanked for prevention;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: Which I in sufferance heartily will rejoice,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: CAMBRIDGE
line: Beseeching God and you to pardon me.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: Never did faithful subject more rejoice

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: At the discovery of most dangerous treason

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: Than I do at this hour joy o'er myself.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: Prevented from a damned enterprise:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: GREY
line: My fault, but not my body, pardon, sovereign.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: God quit you in his mercy! Hear your sentence.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: You have conspired against our royal person,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Join'd with an enemy proclaim'd and from his coffers

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Received the golden earnest of our death;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Wherein you would have sold your king to slaughter,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: His princes and his peers to servitude,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: His subjects to oppression and contempt

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And his whole kingdom into desolation.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Touching our person seek we no revenge;

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: But we our kingdom's safety must so tender,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Whose ruin you have sought, that to her laws

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: We do deliver you. Get you therefore hence,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Poor miserable wretches, to your death:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: The taste whereof, God of his mercy give

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: You patience to endure, and true repentance

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Of all your dear offences! Bear them hence.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Now, lords, for France; the enterprise whereof

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Shall be to you, as us, like glorious.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: We doubt not of a fair and lucky war,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Since God so graciously hath brought to light

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: This dangerous treason lurking in our way

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: To hinder our beginnings. We doubt not now

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: But every rub is smoothed on our way.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Then forth, dear countrymen: let us deliver

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Our puissance into the hand of God,

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Putting it straight in expedition.

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Cheerly to sea; the signs of war advance:

scene: SCENE II.  Southampton. A council-chamber.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: No king of England, if not king of France.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: Prithee, honey-sweet husband, let me bring thee to Staines.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: No; for my manly heart doth yearn.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Bardolph, be blithe: Nym, rouse thy vaunting veins:

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Boy, bristle thy courage up; for Falstaff he is dead,

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: And we must yearn therefore.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Would I were with him, wheresome'er he is, either in

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: heaven or in hell!

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: Nay, sure, he's not in hell: he's in Arthur's

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: bosom, if ever man went to Arthur's bosom. A' made

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: a finer end and went away an it had been any

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: christom child; a' parted even just between twelve

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: and one, even at the turning o' the tide: for after

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: I saw him fumble with the sheets and play with

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: flowers and smile upon his fingers' ends, I knew

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: there was but one way; for his nose was as sharp as

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: a pen, and a' babbled of green fields. 'How now,

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: sir John!' quoth I 'what, man! be o' good

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: cheer.' So a' cried out 'God, God, God!' three or

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: four times. Now I, to comfort him, bid him a'

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: should not think of God; I hoped there was no need

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: to trouble himself with any such thoughts yet. So

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: a' bade me lay more clothes on his feet: I put my

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: hand into the bed and felt them, and they were as

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: cold as any stone; then I felt to his knees, and

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: they were as cold as any stone, and so upward and

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: upward, and all was as cold as any stone.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: NYM
line: They say he cried out of sack.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: Ay, that a' did.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: And of women.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: Nay, that a' did not.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Boy
line: Yes, that a' did; and said they were devils

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Boy
line: incarnate.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: A' could never abide carnation; 'twas a colour he

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: never liked.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Boy
line: A' said once, the devil would have him about women.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: A' did in some sort, indeed, handle women; but then

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: he was rheumatic, and talked of the whore of Babylon.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Boy
line: Do you not remember, a' saw a flea stick upon

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Boy
line: Bardolph's nose, and a' said it was a black soul

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Boy
line: burning in hell-fire?

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Well, the fuel is gone that maintained that fire:

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: that's all the riches I got in his service.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: NYM
line: Shall we shog? the king will be gone from

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: NYM
line: Southampton.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Come, let's away. My love, give me thy lips.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Look to my chattels and my movables:

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Let senses rule; the word is 'Pitch and Pay:'

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Trust none;

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: For oaths are straws, men's faiths are wafer-cakes,

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: And hold-fast is the only dog, my duck:

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Therefore, Caveto be thy counsellor.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Go, clear thy crystals. Yoke-fellows in arms,

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Let us to France; like horse-leeches, my boys,

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: To suck, to suck, the very blood to suck!

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Boy
line: And that's but unwholesome food they say.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Touch her soft mouth, and march.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: Farewell, hostess.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: NYM
line: I cannot kiss, that is the humour of it; but, adieu.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Let housewifery appear: keep close, I thee command.

scene: SCENE III.  London. Before a tavern.
speaker: Hostess
line: Farewell; adieu.

scene: SCENE IV.  France. The KING'S palace.
speaker: KING OF FRANCE
line: Thus comes the English with full power upon us;

scene: SCENE IV.  France. The KING'S palace.
speaker: KING OF FRANCE
line: And more than carefully it us concerns

scene: SCENE IV.  France. The KING'S palace.
speaker: KING OF FRANCE
line: To answer royally in our defences.

scene: SCENE IV.  France. The KING'S palace.
speaker: KING OF FRANCE
line: Therefore the Dukes of Berri and of Bretagne,

scene: SCENE IV.  France. The KING'S palace.
speaker: KING OF FRANCE
line: Of Brabant and of Orleans, shall make forth,
