line: That's a lie in thy throat. I charge you in his

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: majesty's name, apprehend him: he's a friend of the

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Duke Alencon's.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WARWICK
line: How now, how now! what's the matter?

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: My Lord of Warwick, here is--praised be God for it!

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: --a most contagious treason come to light, look

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: you, as you shall desire in a summer's day. Here is

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: his majesty.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: How now! what's the matter?

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: My liege, here is a villain and a traitor, that,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: look your grace, has struck the glove which your

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: majesty is take out of the helmet of Alencon.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: My liege, this was my glove; here is the fellow of

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: it; and he that I gave it to in change promised to

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: wear it in his cap: I promised to strike him, if he

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: did: I met this man with my glove in his cap, and I

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: have been as good as my word.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Your majesty hear now, saving your majesty's

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: manhood, what an arrant, rascally, beggarly, lousy

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: knave it is: I hope your majesty is pear me

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: testimony and witness, and will avouchment, that

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: this is the glove of Alencon, that your majesty is

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: give me; in your conscience, now?

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Give me thy glove, soldier: look, here is the

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: fellow of it.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: 'Twas I, indeed, thou promised'st to strike;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And thou hast given me most bitter terms.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: An please your majesty, let his neck answer for it,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: if there is any martial law in the world.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: How canst thou make me satisfaction?

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: All offences, my lord, come from the heart: never

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: came any from mine that might offend your majesty.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: It was ourself thou didst abuse.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: Your majesty came not like yourself: you appeared to

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: me but as a common man; witness the night, your

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: garments, your lowliness; and what your highness

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: suffered under that shape, I beseech you take it for

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: your own fault and not mine: for had you been as I

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: took you for, I made no offence; therefore, I

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: beseech your highness, pardon me.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Here, uncle Exeter, fill this glove with crowns,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And give it to this fellow. Keep it, fellow;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And wear it for an honour in thy cap

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Till I do challenge it. Give him the crowns:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And, captain, you must needs be friends with him.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: By this day and this light, the fellow has mettle

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: enough in his belly. Hold, there is twelve pence

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: for you; and I pray you to serve Got, and keep you

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: out of prawls, and prabbles' and quarrels, and

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: dissensions, and, I warrant you, it is the better for you.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: WILLIAMS
line: I will none of your money.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: It is with a good will; I can tell you, it will

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: serve you to mend your shoes: come, wherefore should

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: you be so pashful? your shoes is not so good: 'tis

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: a good silling, I warrant you, or I will change it.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Now, herald, are the dead number'd?

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: Herald
line: Here is the number of the slaughter'd French.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: What prisoners of good sort are taken, uncle?

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: EXETER
line: Charles Duke of Orleans, nephew to the king;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: EXETER
line: John Duke of Bourbon, and Lord Bouciqualt:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: EXETER
line: Of other lords and barons, knights and squires,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: EXETER
line: Full fifteen hundred, besides common men.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: This note doth tell me of ten thousand French

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That in the field lie slain: of princes, in this number,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And nobles bearing banners, there lie dead

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: One hundred twenty six: added to these,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Of knights, esquires, and gallant gentlemen,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Eight thousand and four hundred; of the which,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Five hundred were but yesterday dubb'd knights:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: So that, in these ten thousand they have lost,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: There are but sixteen hundred mercenaries;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: The rest are princes, barons, lords, knights, squires,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And gentlemen of blood and quality.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: The names of those their nobles that lie dead:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Charles Delabreth, high constable of France;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Jaques of Chatillon, admiral of France;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: The master of the cross-bows, Lord Rambures;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Great Master of France, the brave Sir Guichard Dolphin,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: John Duke of Alencon, Anthony Duke of Brabant,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: The brother of the Duke of Burgundy,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And Edward Duke of Bar: of lusty earls,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Grandpre and Roussi, Fauconberg and Foix,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Beaumont and Marle, Vaudemont and Lestrale.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Here was a royal fellowship of death!

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Where is the number of our English dead?

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Edward the Duke of York, the Earl of Suffolk,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Sir Richard Ketly, Davy Gam, esquire:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: None else of name; and of all other men

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: But five and twenty. O God, thy arm was here;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And not to us, but to thy arm alone,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Ascribe we all! When, without stratagem,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: But in plain shock and even play of battle,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Was ever known so great and little loss

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: On one part and on the other? Take it, God,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: For it is none but thine!

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: EXETER
line: 'Tis wonderful!

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Come, go we in procession to the village.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And be it death proclaimed through our host

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: To boast of this or take the praise from God

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Which is his only.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Is it not lawful, an please your majesty, to tell

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: how many is killed?

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Yes, captain; but with this acknowledgement,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: That God fought for us.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Yes, my conscience, he did us great good.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Do we all holy rites;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Let there be sung 'Non nobis' and 'Te Deum;'

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: The dead with charity enclosed in clay:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: And then to Calais; and to England then:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Before KING HENRY'S pavilion.
speaker: KING HENRY V
line: Where ne'er from France arrived more happy men.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: Nay, that's right; but why wear you your leek today?

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: Saint Davy's day is past.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: There is occasions and causes why and wherefore in

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: all things: I will tell you, asse my friend,

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Captain Gower: the rascally, scald, beggarly,

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: lousy, pragging knave, Pistol, which you and

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: yourself and all the world know to be no petter

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: than a fellow, look you now, of no merits, he is

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: come to me and prings me pread and salt yesterday,

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: look you, and bid me eat my leek: it was in place

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: where I could not breed no contention with him; but

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: I will be so bold as to wear it in my cap till I see

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: him once again, and then I will tell him a little

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: piece of my desires.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: Why, here he comes, swelling like a turkey-cock.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: 'Tis no matter for his swellings nor his

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: turkey-cocks. God pless you, Aunchient Pistol! you

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: scurvy, lousy knave, God pless you!

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Ha! art thou bedlam? dost thou thirst, base Trojan,

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: To have me fold up Parca's fatal web?

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Hence! I am qualmish at the smell of leek.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: I peseech you heartily, scurvy, lousy knave, at my

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: desires, and my requests, and my petitions, to eat,

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: look you, this leek: because, look you, you do not

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: love it, nor your affections and your appetites and

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: your digestions doo's not agree with it, I would

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: desire you to eat it.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Not for Cadwallader and all his goats.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: There is one goat for you.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Will you be so good, scauld knave, as eat it?

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Base Trojan, thou shalt die.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: You say very true, scauld knave, when God's will is:

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: I will desire you to live in the mean time, and eat

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: your victuals: come, there is sauce for it.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: You called me yesterday mountain-squire; but I will

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: make you to-day a squire of low degree. I pray you,

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: fall to: if you can mock a leek, you can eat a leek.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: Enough, captain: you have astonished him.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: I say, I will make him eat some part of my leek, or

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: I will peat his pate four days. Bite, I pray you; it

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: is good for your green wound and your ploody coxcomb.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Must I bite?

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Yes, certainly, and out of doubt and out of question

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: too, and ambiguities.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: By this leek, I will most horribly revenge: I eat

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: and eat, I swear--

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Eat, I pray you: will you have some more sauce to

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: your leek? there is not enough leek to swear by.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Quiet thy cudgel; thou dost see I eat.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Much good do you, scauld knave, heartily. Nay, pray

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: you, throw none away; the skin is good for your

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: broken coxcomb. When you take occasions to see leeks

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: hereafter, I pray you, mock at 'em; that is all.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Good.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Ay, leeks is good: hold you, there is a groat to

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: heal your pate.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Me a groat!

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: Yes, verily and in truth, you shall take it; or I

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: have another leek in my pocket, which you shall eat.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: I take thy groat in earnest of revenge.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: If I owe you any thing, I will pay you in cudgels:

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: you shall be a woodmonger, and buy nothing of me but

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: FLUELLEN
line: cudgels. God b' wi' you, and keep you, and heal your pate.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: All hell shall stir for this.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: Go, go; you are a counterfeit cowardly knave. Will

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: you mock at an ancient tradition, begun upon an

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: honourable respect, and worn as a memorable trophy of

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: predeceased valour and dare not avouch in your deeds

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: any of your words? I have seen you gleeking and

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: galling at this gentleman twice or thrice. You

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: thought, because he could not speak English in the

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: native garb, he could not therefore handle an

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: English cudgel: you find it otherwise; and

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: henceforth let a Welsh correction teach you a good

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: GOWER
line: English condition. Fare ye well.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Doth Fortune play the huswife with me now?

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: News have I, that my Nell is dead i' the spital

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Of malady of France;

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: And there my rendezvous is quite cut off.

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Old I do wax; and from my weary limbs

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
speaker: PISTOL
line: Honour is cudgelled. Well, bawd I'll turn,

scene: SCENE I.  France. The English camp.
